name: ginkgo
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a Chinese tree whose leaves are used in traditional medicine and whose nuts and seeds are used in cooking: Plants such as ginseng, ginger and gingko are common in herbal stimulants.
HeikeRau/iStock/Getty Images Plus/GettyImages
More examplesFewer examples Clinical evidence has shown that ginkgo's benefits come from a particular extract of the leaf.He believes that gingko biloba sharpens his mind.She grows tea roses, dogwoods and ginkgo trees.The garden has such exquisite Asian trees as the Chinese ginkgo and white-flowered dove tree.Add 1 tablespoon of the sesame oil and the gingko nuts.
